  1. (**************************************************************************)
  2. (*                                                                        *)
  3. (*                                 OCaml                                  *)
  4. (*                                                                        *)

  6. (*                    Mark Shinwell, Jane Street Europe                   *)

  15. (**************************************************************************)

  17. open Mach
  18. open Linear

  20. module Make (T : Branch_relaxation_intf.S) = struct
  21. ‌  let label_map f =
  22.     let map = Hashtbl.create 37 in
  23.     let rec fill_map pc instr =
  24.       match instr.desc with
  25.       | Lend -> (pc, map)
  26.       | Llabel lbl -> Hashtbl.add map lbl pc; fill_map pc instr.next
  27.       | op -> fill_map (pc + T.instr_size f op) instr.next
  28.     in
  29.     fill_map 0 f.fun_body

  31. ‌  let branch_overflows map pc_branch lbl_dest max_branch_offset =
  32.     let pc_dest = Hashtbl.find map lbl_dest in
  33.     let delta = pc_dest - (pc_branch + T.offset_pc_at_branch) in
  34.     delta <= -max_branch_offset || delta >= max_branch_offset

  36. ‌  let opt_branch_overflows map pc_branch opt_lbl_dest max_branch_offset =
  37.     match opt_lbl_dest with
  38.     | None -> false
  39.     | Some lbl_dest ->
  40.       branch_overflows map pc_branch lbl_dest max_branch_offset

  42. ‌  let instr_overflows ~code_size ~max_out_of_line_code_offset instr map pc =
  43.     match T.Cond_branch.classify_instr instr.desc with
  44.     | None -> false
  45.     | Some branch ->
  46.       let max_branch_offset =
  47.         (* Remember to cut some slack for multi-word instructions (in the
  48.            [Linear] sense of the word) where the branch can be anywhere in
  49.            the middle.  12 words of slack is plenty. *)
  50.         T.Cond_branch.max_displacement branch - 12
  51.       in
  52.       match instr.desc with
  53.       | Lop (Ialloc _)
  54.       | Lop (Ipoll { return_label = None })
  55.       | Lop (Iintop (Icheckbound))
  56.       | Lop (Iintop_imm (Icheckbound, _))
  57.       | Lop (Ispecific _) ->
  58.         (* We assume that any branches eligible for relaxation generated
  59.            by these instructions only branch forward.  We further assume
  60.            that any of these may branch to an out-of-line code block. *)
  61.         code_size + max_out_of_line_code_offset - pc >= max_branch_offset
  62.       | Lcondbranch (_, lbl) ->
  63.         branch_overflows map pc lbl max_branch_offset
  64.       | Lcondbranch3 (lbl0, lbl1, lbl2) ->
  65.         opt_branch_overflows map pc lbl0 max_branch_offset
  66.           || opt_branch_overflows map pc lbl1 max_branch_offset
  67.           || opt_branch_overflows map pc lbl2 max_branch_offset
  68.       | Lop (Ipoll { return_label = Some lbl }) ->
  69.         (* A poll-and-branch instruction can branch to the label lbl,
  70.            but also to an out-of-line code block. *)
  71.         code_size + max_out_of_line_code_offset - pc >= max_branch_offset
  72.         || branch_overflows map pc lbl max_branch_offset
  73.       | _ ->
  74.         Misc.fatal_error "Unsupported instruction for branch relaxation"

  76. ‌  let fixup_branches ~code_size ~max_out_of_line_code_offset map f =
  77.     let expand_optbranch lbl n arg next =
  78.       match lbl with
  79.       | None -> next
  80.       | Some l ->
  81.         instr_cons (Lcondbranch (Iinttest_imm (Isigned Cmm.Ceq, n), l))
  82.           arg [||] next
  83.     in
  84.     let rec fixup did_fix pc instr =
  85.       match instr.desc with
  86.       | Lend -> did_fix
  87.       | _ ->
  88.         let overflows =
  89.           instr_overflows ~code_size ~max_out_of_line_code_offset instr map pc
  90.         in
  91.         if not overflows then
  92.           fixup did_fix (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  93.         else
  94.           match instr.desc with
  95.           | Lop (Ipoll { return_label }) ->
  96.             instr.desc <- T.relax_poll ~return_label;
  97.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  98.           | Lop (Ialloc { bytes = num_bytes; dbginfo }) ->
  99.             instr.desc <- T.relax_allocation ~num_bytes ~dbginfo;
  100.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  101.           | Lop (Iintop (Icheckbound)) ->
  102.             instr.desc <- T.relax_intop_checkbound ();
  103.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  104.           | Lop (Iintop_imm (Icheckbound, bound)) ->
  105.             instr.desc
  106.               <- T.relax_intop_imm_checkbound ~bound;
  107.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  108.           | Lop (Ispecific specific) ->
  109.             instr.desc <- T.relax_specific_op specific;
  110.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  111.           | Lcondbranch (test, lbl) ->
  112.             let lbl2 = Cmm.new_label() in
  113.             let cont =
  114.               instr_cons (Lbranch lbl) [||] [||]
  115.                 (instr_cons (Llabel lbl2) [||] [||] instr.next)
  116.             in
  117.             instr.desc <- Lcondbranch (invert_test test, lbl2);
  118.             instr.next <- cont;
  119.             fixup true (pc + T.instr_size f instr.desc) instr.next
  120.           | Lcondbranch3 (lbl0, lbl1, lbl2) ->
  121.             let cont =
  122.               expand_optbranch lbl0 0 instr.arg
  123.                 (expand_optbranch lbl1 1 instr.arg
  124.                   (expand_optbranch lbl2 2 instr.arg instr.next))
  125.             in
  126.             instr.desc <- cont.desc;
  127.             instr.next <- cont.next;
  128.             fixup true pc instr
  129.           | _ ->
  130.             (* Any other instruction has already been rejected in
  131.                [instr_overflows] above.
  132.                We can *never* get here. *)
  133.             assert false
  134.     in
  135.     fixup false 0 f.fun_body

  137.   (* Iterate branch expansion till all conditional branches are OK *)

  139. ‌  let rec relax f ~max_out_of_line_code_offset =
  140.     let min_of_max_branch_offsets =
  141.       List.fold_left (fun min_of_max_branch_offsets branch ->
  142.           Int.min min_of_max_branch_offsets
  143.             (T.Cond_branch.max_displacement branch))
  144.         max_int T.Cond_branch.all
  145.     in
  146.     let (code_size, map) = label_map f in
  147.     if code_size >= min_of_max_branch_offsets
  148.         && fixup_branches ~code_size ~max_out_of_line_code_offset map f
  149.     then relax f ~max_out_of_line_code_offset
  150.     else ()
  151. end
